main event: Two separate sightings in North Carolina and South Carolina, both reporting a circular, bright silver object hovering at low altitudes and then traveling rapidly west before disappearing without making any sound.
interesting points: Both sightings described an object of 30' - 40' in diameter and bright silver in color.
The objects were observed to hover at low altitude for a brief period before traveling rapidly in a westerly direction.
No sound was heard during the observed travel of the objects.
The objects in both sightings maintained a steady course during their observed travel.
Witnesses reported a steady course at approximately 25' elevation on the western horizon before the objects disappeared suddenly.
